context: I am crucified with Christ, nevertheless I live, yet not I, but Christ liveth in me. And the life which I now live in the flesh, I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
As we come to Galatians chapter six and beginning in verse number seven, the Bible says this, be not deceived. God is not mocked. For whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
when we look at the truth of Galatians six and verse seven, many times we deal with it from a perspective of the negative.
And we see that in verse number eight, notice he says, for he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption. But he that soweth to the spirit shall of the spirit reap life everlasting.
And then we see in verse number nine, notice what he says, and let us not be weary in well-doing.
let us not be weary in well-doing for in due season we shall reap if we faint not
Paul would say this to those that he's writing to in the region of Galatia, you don't need to turn there, but in Galatians chapter number one, he would tell these churches in the region of Galatia

He says in verse number 11 of Galatians one, but I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man, for I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
